00168    /*
00169    * Default contructor
00170    */
00171    template <class Data>
00172    RingBuffer<Data>::RingBuffer()
00173     : data_(0),
00174       capacity_(0),
00175       size_(0),
00176       last_(0)
00177    {}
00178 
00179    /*
00180    * Copy constructor.
00181    *
00182    * Allocates new memory and copies all elements by value.
00183    *
00184    *\param other the RingBuffer to be copied.
00185    */
00186    template <class Data>
00187    RingBuffer<Data>::RingBuffer(const RingBuffer<Data>& other) 
00188     : data_(0),
00189       capacity_(0),
00190       size_(0),
00191       last_(0)
00192    {
00193       if (other.capacity_ > 0) {
00194          assert(other.data_ != 0);
00195          data_ = new Data[capacity_];
00196          capacity_ = other.capacity_;
00197          size_     = other.size_;
00198          last_     = other.last_;
00199          for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00200             data_[i] = other.data_[i];
00201          }
00202       }
00203    }
00204 
00205    /*
00206    * Assignment, element-by-element.
00207    *
00208    * Assignment is allowed only for allocated RingBuffer objects of equal 
00209    * capacity.  This operator will allocate this RingBuffer if it was not 
00210    * allocated previously.
00211    */
00212    template <class Data>
00213    RingBuffer<Data>& 
00214    RingBuffer<Data>::operator = (const RingBuffer<Data>& other) 
00215    {
00216 
00217       // Check for self assignment
00218       if (this == &other) return *this;
00219 
00220       if (other.isAllocated()) {
00221 
00222          assert(other.capacity_ > 0);
00223 
00224          if (!isAllocated()) {
00225 
00226             data_ = new Data[other.capacity_];
00227             capacity_ = other.capacity_;
00228 
00229          } else if (capacity_ != other.capacity_) {
00230 
00231             UTIL_THROW("Cannot assign RingBuffers of unequal capacity");
00232 
00233          }
00234 
00235          size_ = other.size_;
00236          last_ = other.last_;
00237 
00238          for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00239             data_[i] = other.data_[i];
00240          }
00241 
00242       } else if (isAllocated()) {
00243          UTIL_THROW("Cannot assign unallocated array to allocated array");
00244       }
00245 
00246       return *this;
00247    }
00248 
00250    template <class Data>
00251    RingBuffer<Data>::~RingBuffer()
00252    {
00253       if (data_) {
00254          delete [] data_;
00255       }
00256    }
00257 
00259    template <class Data>
00260    void  RingBuffer<Data>::allocate(int capacity) 
00261    {
00262       if (data_ == 0) {
00263          data_     = new Data[capacity];
00264          capacity_ = capacity;
00265       } else {
00266          UTIL_THROW("Error: Attempt to re-allocate a RingBuffer");
00267       }
00268       last_ = capacity_ - 1; 
00269       size_ = 0;        // No values in buffer
00270    }
00271 
00272    /*
00273    * Set buffer to empty state, by resetting counters.
00274    */
00275    template <class Data>
00276    void RingBuffer<Data>::clear()
00277    {
00278       last_  = capacity_ - 1; 
00279       size_  = 0;        
00280    }
00281  
00282    /* 
00283    * Append a new value to the end of the buffer
00284    */
00285    template <class Data>
00286    void RingBuffer<Data>::append(Data data) 
00287    {
00288       assert(last_ < capacity_);
00289       ++last_;
00290       if (last_ == capacity_) {
00291          last_ = 0; // wrap around
00292       };
00293       data_[last_] = data;
00294    
00295       // If buffer is not yet full, update size_
00296       if (size_ < capacity_) {
00297          ++size_;
00298       };
00299 
00300    }
00301    
00302    /*
00303    * Return number of values in buffer.
00304    */
00305    template <class Data>
00306    int RingBuffer<Data>::size() const
00307    { return size_; }
00308   
00309    /*
00310    * Return the capacity of the buffer.
00311    */
00312    template <class Data>
00313    int RingBuffer<Data>::capacity() const
00314    { return capacity_; }
00315  
00316    /* 
00317    * Return true if the RingBuffer has been allocated, false otherwise.
00318    */
00319    template <class Data>
00320    bool RingBuffer<Data>::isAllocated() const
00321    {  return (data_ != 0); }
00322   
00323    /* 
00324    * Return true if the RingBuffer is full.
00325    */
00326    template <class Data>
00327    bool RingBuffer<Data>::isFull()
00328    {  return (size_ == capacity_); }
00329   
00330    /*
00331    * Retrive a previous value, index backwards from 0 (current)
00332    */
00333    template <class Data>
00334    Data RingBuffer<Data>::operator [] (int offset) const
00335    {
00336       if ( offset >= size_ )  {
00337          UTIL_THROW("offset >= size_");
00338       }
00339       int i;
00340       i = last_ - offset;
00341       if (i < 0) {
00342          i = i + capacity_;
00343       }
00344       return data_[i];
00345    }
00346  
00347    /*
00348    * Pack this RingBuffer into a block of memory.
00349    */
00350    template <typename Data>
00351    void RingBuffer<Data>::pack(char*& current, char* end) const
00352    {
00353       if (current + packedSize() > end) {
00354          UTIL_THROW("Attempted write past end of send buffer");
00355       }
00356     
00357       int* capacityPtr = (int*)current;
00358       *capacityPtr = capacity_;
00359 
00360       int* sizePtr = (int*)(capacityPtr+1);
00361       *sizePtr = size_;
00362 
00363       int* lastPtr = (int*)(sizePtr+1);
00364       *lastPtr = last_;
00365 
00366       Data* ptr = (Data *)(lastPtr + 1);
00367       for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00368          *(ptr+i)=data_[i];
00369       }
00370       current = (char*)(ptr + capacity_);
00371    }
00372 
00373    /*
00374    * Unpack a RingBuffer from a block of memory.
00375    */
00376    template <typename Data>
00377    void RingBuffer<Data>::unpack(char*& current, char* end)
00378    {
00379       if (current + packedSize() > end) {
00380          UTIL_THROW("Attempted read past end of recv buffer");
00381       }
00382 
00383       // Read capacity of RingBuffer being received.
00384       int* capacityPtr = (int*)current;
00385       capacity_ = *capacityPtr;
00386       
00387       int capacityOther = *capacityPtr;
00388       if (capacity_ != capacityOther) {
00389          UTIL_THROW("Inconsistent RingBuffer capacities");
00390       } 
00391 
00392       int* sizePtr = (int*)(capacityPtr+1);
00393       size_ = *sizePtr;
00394 
00395       int* lastPtr = (int*)(sizePtr+1);
00396       last_ = *lastPtr;
00397 
00398       Data* ptr = (Data *)(lastPtr + 1);
00399       for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00400          data_[i] = *(ptr+i);
00401       }
00402       current = (char*)(ptr + capacity_);
00403    }
00404 
00405    /*
00406    * Pack this RingBuffer into a PackedData object.
00407    */
00408    template <class Data>
00409    void RingBuffer<Data>::pack(PackedData& buffer) const 
00410    {
00411       buffer.pack(capacity_);
00412       buffer.pack(size_);
00413       buffer.pack(last_);
00414       buffer.pack(data_, capacity_);
00415    }
00416 
00417    /*
00418    * Unpack this RingBuffer from a PackedData object.
00419    */
00420    template <class Data>
00421    void RingBuffer<Data>::unpack(PackedData& buffer)
00422    {
00423       int capacity;
00424       buffer.unpack(capacity);
00425       if (capacity_ != capacity) {
00426          UTIL_THROW("Inconsistent RingBuffer capacities");
00427       } 
00428       buffer.unpack(size_);
00429       buffer.unpack(last_);
00430       buffer.unpack(data_, capacity_);
00431    }
00432 
00433    template <typename Data>
00434    int RingBuffer<Data>::packedSize() const
00435    {
00436       int size;
00437       size = capacity_*sizeof(Data) + 3*sizeof(int);
00438       return size;
00439    }
00440 
00441    /*
00442    * Serialize a RingBuffer to/from an Archive.
00443    */
00444    template <class Data>
00445    template <class Archive>
00446    void RingBuffer<Data>::serialize(Archive& ar, const unsigned int version)
00447    {
00448       int capacity;
00449       if (Archive::is_saving()) {
00450          capacity = capacity_;
00451       }
00452       ar & capacity;
00453       if (Archive::is_loading()) {
00454          if (!isAllocated()) {
00455             if (capacity > 0) {
00456                allocate(capacity);
00457             } else {
00458                capacity_ = 0;
00459             }
00460          } else {
00461             if (capacity != capacity_) {
00462                UTIL_THROW("Inconsistent RingBuffer capacities");
00463             }
00464          }
00465       }
00466       ar & size_;
00467       ar & last_;
00468       for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00469          ar & data_[i];
00470       }
00471    }
